newsitem.title: USA: DVI secures $50 mln credit line.
newsitem.headline: DVI secures $50 mln credit line.

text.p: DVI Inc said it had closed a $50 million secured warehouse credit facility with CS First Boston for its DVI Business Credit subsidiary.
DVI Business would use the funds to "warehouse and securitize medical accounts receivable-backed loans to healthcare providers," DVI said in a statement.

"This facility will more than double our current warehouse and securitization capacity for medical receivables, thereby allowing us to aggressively pursue a market segment we believe to be a key element in the future growth of DVI," DVI President and Chief Executive Officer Michael O'Hanlon said in a statement.
O'Hanlon said the facility was priced competitively.
Ascendant Capital was the structuring agent, DVI said.
